body:
I want to start by saying that this should be kept serious and mature. I would like this thread to be somewhere where the community can give their input on who they feel would do well in a staff position. Just give your recommendations, don't bash on other people. Everyone is entitled to their own opinions. Seeing as their was a thread similar to this before Avicore was released, the presence of one shouldn't be a problem, assuming that everyone behaves like they should. So please do. 
So, who do you think will be the next staff member? 

A few guidelines:
Please do not suggest yourself
Please do not say rude or antagonistic things about others' posts: if you disagree with something, be mature and keep it to yourself
Please support your recommendations. A few words will do. 

I'll start it off by saying that Merlinmaster is a pretty cool guy. He's calm, he's mature, and he knows how to handle himself. He'd be a great candidate for Junior, in my opinion.
Also, I can see jozzmcozz and NolanDalton doing very well as Senior Moderators. I think both of them have what it takes to take on the next level of responsibility. 
That's just my list for now, I will of course update it as necessary.

replies.body:
I'm just going to touch up on something real quick here, nobody deserves to get mod. That's not how it works, even the most "deserving" people may not get to be a moderator if they don't fit standards. The application process rewards not the people that "deserve" moderator, but the people that have what it takes to be a mod. You can be an active nice member in the community, but if you can't write a great application or have the ability to speak in front of others, then you don't qualify to be a moderator. It's not about deserving, it's about earning. 

(Sorry for the mini rant :P)

replies.body:
If my claims don't suffice, I always have Bandicam. Try refuting that... nah, I'm only kidding; disregard that last remark. In all seriousness, yes, I do rant about lag a lot. Probably a (literal) dozen times a day. It's what happens after being subject to so much vitriolic invective and stress all day and having nowhere to go to release it.

Though, whining incessantly in such a manner isn't really against the rules... fundamentally. Rather, I think the intensity of my nihilistic demeanor is what's reprehensible. Moreover, one's in-game conduct isn't the best touchstone for conjecturing how they would act elsewhere or under different circumstances.

Personally, I don't think I'd even do well as a staff member... Avicus only ever captivated me with its gameplay, not its community (don't get me wrong, you guys are pleasantly amicable as well). Having to then handle such an onerous responsibility and put up with endless bickering and complaints  "I was falsely banned, that moderator is an idiot"  sounds very daunting...

Personally, I don't think I'd even do well as a staff member... Avicus only ever captivated me with its gameplay, not its community (don't get me wrong, you guys are pleasantly amicable as well). Having to then handle such an onerous responsibility and put up with endless bickering and complaints  "I was falsely banned, that moderator is an idiot"  sounds very daunting...

replies.body: First of all, I would like to congratulate those who have been accepted for review. However, I hope everyone keeps this in mind, even if your name is not said here you are still going to have the same chance at getting Jr. Mod, as opposed to someone who gets mentioned 100 times. Personally, when I got promoted 0 people "vouched" for me, and guess what. It did bring me down, however; I let my lack of inclusion within this post propel me farther then I ever would have, had I been suggested 20 times. Let your underdog like characteristics send you rocketing into the interviews! Overall, what I'm trying too say is don't take this post personally, if you aren't on it don't sweat it!

replies.body:
That's incorrect. I haven't scratched the surface of this server in almost half a year and I can tell you that's wrong. If they wanted active staff members they would select solely regular players who come on more often than others (basically pick your favorite from top 15). Now most of those in or near the top 15 have been staff. The argument towards this was that they were "more active" and it wasn't biased. As much as that is true, their success wasn't based off of how much they played the game and never was. They likely had good applications for the time and were promoted because they were entrusted with the ability to run the server. Now getting denied for... mod tryharding? Seems a little silly from my perspective. I don't understand how you can't tryhard for mod. 

Oh oh yes and to my original point, staff are going to be flooding the server after promotions. Basically there will be too many staff online and they will simply hog each other's reports. So your problem will essentially be nullified by the time of the promotions. 

@MasterPro If I can make a small suggestion, try not to be as verbose as that. I know it sounds odd, but there are some people on this server that can't comprehend your level of literature. If they can't read it then it basically defeats the purpose of writing out the post. If it's habitual then I don't care, don't listen to me, I'm just some guy on the internet

Just back for this one post.

replies.body:
I suppose there's irony in that I purposely went out of my way to simplify that reply before posting it, which I usually don't spend time doing... nonetheless, I see no point in doing so all the time, since what I post generally isn't that insightful anyway. I get what you mean, but unless I was given a significant job, such as relaying an announcement to the entire community (in which case I'd do so in a manner such that every person who reads it can understand), there's no crucial need to speak conversationally I never seem to get acknowledged anyway, regardless of the circumstances.

Also, I deliberately make my posts hard to comprehend sometimes; you can say almost anything you want on the forums, as long as you say it the right way... but, I digress. I'd love to see Hacktivism as a staff member again, but, in light of recent events, I don't think that's going to happen anytime soon.
